author: Maria Akram
text:
Even as JNU students’ union president Kanhaiya Kumar was released from Tihar Jail on Thursday evening on interim bail, the Delhi government is contemplating filing criminal cases against TV channels for allegedly tampering with the videos of the controversial JNU event held on February 9.

The move comes as the Aam Aadmi Party government is convinced that the JNU incident cannot be a sedition case. Even the forensic lab report states that of the seven video clips, two were doctored and the Delhi government’s probe report has given clean chit to the students.
title: Channels face action over videos
